675402.name: Wrist & Ankle Warmers
675402.notes_html:
These quick little warmers are an ideal project for beginners to circular knitting. Knit in a super bulky, super soft, super warm merino wool yarn, they are ideal for those with rheumatoid arthritis or other circulation disorders. They make perfect last minute gifts and can be worn with mittens, to cover the exposed area between the mitten cuff and coat.

Materials Required:
90-180 yds super bulky weight yarn
US 11 (8 mm) DPNs
Tapestry needle

Materials Shown Here:
1-2 hanks Malabrigo Rasta (100% Merino Wool; 90 yds), in color #052 Paris Night

701050.name: Braille Hat
701050.notes_html: I have a blind cousin learning Braille in the first grade. I wanted to make a hat that he could “read” and always identify as his. Unable to find an existing pattern on Ravelry, I created one to share.

733802.name: Drawn Convertible Mitts
733802.sizes_available: 3 adult sizes. Circumference around palm of aprox. 7 in/18cm (Small),  8 in/20cm (Medium),  8.8 in/22cm (Large)
733802.notes_html:
Drawstring convertible mittens will solve all your problems. Well, okay… not really, but they will solve all your mitten problems. With the top ribbing folded down, you’ve got fingerless mitts. With the ribbing up and the drawstring tied tight: you’ve got mittens, with none of the palm bulk, buttons, or drafts that come with fold-over-top style convertible mitts. Plus, you’ve got a bow. The thumb is a tube of ribbing that can be folded up or down. Great for commutes, chores, an evening out, or any time you need some mitten versatility.

The mitt features a horizontal stripe pattern in 2 colors of aran weight yarn. Some strategically placed slipped stitches form vertical stripes outlining the gusset and sides of the mitt. This is decorative, but also sneakily obscures the color jog at the start of each round that comes with knitting stripes in the round. Pattern includes complete written directions and charts of the palm and thumb gusset for each size.

Yarn: 2 colors of aran weight yarn. Shown in Malabrigo Merino Worsted (210yds./192m., 3.53oz./ 100g.) (MC) 50 Roanoke and (CC) 27 Bobby Blue. For size M, I used about 1⁄2 a skein for the MC and less than 1⁄4 skein for the CC- a great project for leftovers!
Gauge: 4.5 sts/in (18 sts/4in, 18sts/10cm).
Needles: In size needed to get gauge. I used US 5/3.75mm DPNs.
Notions: (Optional) Two lengths of thin ribbon or cord, 12-14 in/30.5-35.5 cm long, if you’d rather use it for drawstrings (instead of making your drawstring using I-cord, braiding, or single crochet).
Sizes: 3 adult sizes. Circumference around palm of aprox. 7 in/18cm (Small), 8 in/20cm (Medium), 8.8 in/22cm (Large). Shown in size Medium. “Customize” section includes information on altering size.
Skills: Cast on, cast off, knit, purl, knit in the round on DPN’s, M1 increase, YO increase, SSK decrease, K2tog decrease, slip stitches, place stitches on waste yarn/holder, pick up stitches. Optional: I-cord, single crochet, or braiding (for drawstring).
Accessibility Notes: All charted sections also written, 12 point serif font with bolded and underlined headings, no columns (except for abbreviation key). Due to unusual drawstring construction (no drafts!), they may be particularly useful to those with circulatory problems (such as Raynauds), especially when used as an additional layer over gloves.

738179.name: Instant Winter Socks (Toe Up)
738179.sizes_available: 3 adult sizes: Small-7in/ 18cm around, Medium- 8.5in/ 22cm around, Large- 10in/ 26cm around. Any length.
738179.notes_html:
Create marled socks in custom colors using two strands of sock yarn. The perfect socks for cold feet, fast gifts, or impatient knitters. Plus, a fun solution to “buying too much sock yarn”. Great winter boot socks, and ideal for padding around the house on frosty mornings.

Ribbed Toe-up socks with Short-row toes and extra-deep short-row heels. In 3 adult sizes with full written instructions, customization ideas, and resizing guidelines. All the math has been done for you, just sit back and knit some (super fast!) socks.

Cuff down version also available.

Yarn: Knit with 2 strands of sock weight yarn, held double. A great project for scraps, or try one self-striping skein and one solid skein. Yardage/ meterage will vary depending on length.

Size S shown in: scraps of 4 self-striping sock yarns- 3 colors of Online Supersocke “Canaria” plus Opal “The Little Prince” 7764. Size M shown in: Cascade “Heritage Solids Sock” 5632 Plum, and SMC “Fine Wool” 2074 (brown). Size L shown in: Lion Brand “Sock-Ease” Green Apple, and blue striped Online Supersocke “Canaria”.

Gauge: In pattern: 22sts/ 4in, 22sts/ 10cm (5.5sts/ in). Row gauge: 30sts/ 4in, 30 sts/ 10cm (7.5sts/ in).

Needles & Notions: 1 stitch marker. 5 DPNs in size needed to obtain gauge. I used US size 3/ 3.25 mm. Pattern also includes notes to adapt to other needle configurations.

Sizes: 3 adult sizes (by circumference), any length. Choose a size with about 1in/ 2.5cm of negative ease. 7in/ 18cm (shown), 8.5in/ 22cm, 10in/ 26cm. See “Customize” section for additional gauges/ sizes.

Skills: Knit, purl, work in the round on DPNs, figure-8 cast on, OR Judy’s magic cast on, OR crochet provisional cast on, wrap & turn short rows, decreases, bind off.
Accessibility Notes: Pattern features: 12 point san-serif font with bolded 14 point headings, no columns (except abbreviation key). Due to additional thickness & warmth, they may be particularly useful to those with circulatory problems (such as Raynauds). Also nice when reversed, if “princess soles” are preferred.

740590.name: The Sweet Madelyn Shawl
740590.gauge_description: 7 stitches and 10 rows = 2 inches in Double Seed Stitch
740590.notes_html:
Hello! I am the owner of Beala Designs where part of my love is knitting and crocheting. This shawl was designed for a friend who spends much of her time in a wheelchair. She needed a shawl that was not as likely to get bunched up in the small of her back or pinned under her tush (hence the missing point in the back) as a traditional triangular shawl. A rectangular wrap would have solved that problem, but I also wanted a shape that would cuddle her effortlessly and not fall off her shoulders. I chose Dreambaby yarn because it is super snuggly and it can be machine washed and dried--very important for someone in a care facility.

The pattern is worked from the bottom up making it very easy to adjust to suit any yarn weight and any size. Simply use the needle size recommended on the yarn label and stop knitting when the desired length is reached. Written instructions include notes to assist with such changes.

I have included instructions for adding an optional half shell crochet border, but it’s just as beautiful without a border! Many types of decorative borders would work well. Add your favorite to personalize it a bit.

I hope you enjoy this pattern and I look forward to seeing your pics!

THIS PATTERN (TEXT AND PHOTOS) ARE THE PROPERTY OF BEALA DESIGNS AND MAY NOT BE SOLD OR OTHERWISE DISTRIBUTED IN ANY FORMAT. THIS PATTERN IS FOR YOUR PERSONAL USE ONLY. THE PATTERNS ARE SOLD ON AN “AS IS” BASIS AND BEALA DESIGNS MAKES NO OTHER REPRESENTATIONS OR WARRANTIES OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED.

760870.name: Comfy Sock Recipe
760870.gauge_description: 9 stitches and 12 rows = 1 inch in stockinette stitch
760870.notes_html:
The pattern has been technically edited and test knit to ensure you are buying a quality pattern that can be used for years to come.

I have designed this pattern as a recipe combining the most comfortable knitting techniques I have found when knitting and researching hand knitted socks.

People who have sensitive feet, me included, can sometimes find that knitted socks cause a burning sensation on the soles of their feet. Other people need socks that do not restrict circulation to their feet or legs. The instructions in this pattern are written to create a pair of socks that are comfortable and healthy to wear. My son is diabetic and finds these socks really beneficial to his foot health.

The socks are knit from the top down and instructions are given for knitting in the round using 9” circular needles, however the pattern can easily be converted to your favourite sock knitting method using DPNs or Magic Loop on longer circular needles.

This ‘Sock Recipe’ can be adapted to incorporate any
decorative stitch to enhance the look of your socks. Add cables, motifs, and colours to create your own unique pair of comfortable socks.

Copyright Cheryl Costin Knitwear Design 2015 ©
This pattern, including photos & charts, are the property of the designer and may not be sold or distributed in any form digital or physical. Any items made from a Chez Design pattern are your own work and may be loved, gifted or sold.

773061.name: Misticle
773061.sizes_available: S, M, L, easily adjustable for other sizes
773061.gauge_description: 38 stitches and 52 rows = 4 inches in reverse stockinette, blocked
773061.notes_html:
This unisex cuff-down sock features a simple cable and broken rib design, framed by reverse stockinette side panels, with a rounded toe, ribbed fleegle/strong heel and a “princess sole” - the smooth knit stitches are on the inside, against the sole of the foot. This design was originally inspired by a sweater worn by the character of Alex in the TV show “The Mist” (2017), which is based on the written work of Stephen King.

Three sizes are given: S (70), M (74), L (78st) to fit a mid-calf circumference of approximately 19, 22 and 24.5cm (7.5, 8.5 and 9.5 inches). Larger, smaller, or intermediary sizes can be easily made by adding or removing purl columns at the sides of the sock/chart edges. Leg height, foot length and foot width are completely adjustable.

Instructions are both fully charted and written. Two toe options are given - patterned or reverse stockinette.

Feedback is always welcome via comment or PM.

Thank you to my sock testers!

pattern_author.name: Michelle Leanne Martin
pattern_author.notes:
![image title][1]

I think socks are a wonderful platform for creativity. They don't take too long but there's enough room on them to do an infinite amount of things. I like to experiment with different techniques and ideas and as a result some of my patterns are quite challenging, while others are very straightforward. In the future I hope to expand into gloves and other items as well.

Every sale in this tiny business is very much appreciated and helps pay for my yarn & needles :)

Happy knitting!
Michelle


 


  [1]: https://goo.gl/rYjJX7

783077.name: Grand Canyon Shawl
783077.gauge_description: 12 stitches and 7 rows = 4 inches in double crochets
783077.notes_html:
The Grand Canyon Shawl is the perfect accessory for your wardrobe or to give as a gift. This would also make a great gift for an elderly person or person confined to a wheelchair.

This is an intermediate level pattern and within the pattern is a link to a very detailed, step-by-step photo tutorial depicting how to execute all of the stitches necessary to make this shawl.

This shawl is V-shaped and the length in the back is long enough to cover your rear, while the front hangs at a comfortable length so as not to get in your way as you move around. If you require something longer or shorter, the pattern is easily customizable by adding or removing rows.

Because of the nature of the design, each row contains the same amount of stitches throughout. So changing the amount of rows will not alter the design.

This pattern has been updated to include the original which is a L/XL, 2XL, 3XL. If you would like a S/M, leave the beginning chain the same and eliminate about 6-8 rows.

users.about_me:
Hey Everyone!

My name is Erica. I have a wonderful husband and three sons...my last 2 were twins so we decided that when they start coming out in doubles, it's time to stop! LOL!I live in the mountains of PA and have 4 dogs! 

I've been crocheting for more than 15 years now and designing my own patterns since almost the very beginning. On my blog I offer my designs for free, so be sure to check that out.

I love designing crochet items and am incredibly thrilled to be able to share them with the world. The patterns range from easy to detailed so that there is something available for every skill level.

Thanks for stopping by!

786811.name: Sleepy Time Tunic
786811.gauge_description: 24 stitches and 30 rows = 4 inches in Stockinette Stitch
786811.notes_html:
Skill Level: Intermediate

About:
Many toddlers with sensory issues
dislike blankets & tight clothing but
require wintertime warmth. This is
a knitted version of a classic cotton
nightshirt featuring a Henley style
round neck, bell or gathered modified
drop shoulder sleeve option, & kneelength
shirttail hem. The base is knit
in stockinette while the top at the
underarm is garter stitch thereby
creating a visual empire waist.

When choosing a size, consider
the pattern has 4”/10cm of ease
at the waist & hips, and 2”/5cm
from the armhole to neck

-Finished Measurements-
Chest: 22 (23, 24, 25, 26, 26¾)”/56 (58.4, 61, 63.5, 66, 68)cm
Hips: 25 (26, 27, 28, 29, 29¾)”/63.5 (66, 68.6, 71.1, 73.7, 75.6)cm
786811.notes:
Skill Level: Intermediate

About:
Many toddlers with sensory issues
dislike blankets & tight clothing but
require wintertime warmth. This is
a knitted version of a classic cotton
nightshirt featuring a Henley style
round neck, bell or gathered modified
drop shoulder sleeve option, & kneelength
shirttail hem. The base is knit
in stockinette while the top at the
underarm is garter stitch thereby
creating a visual empire waist.

When choosing a size, consider
the pattern has 4”/10cm of ease
at the waist & hips, and 2”/5cm
from the armhole to neck

-Finished Measurements-
Chest: 22 (23, 24, 25, 26, 26¾)”/56 (58.4, 61, 63.5, 66, 68)cm
Hips: 25 (26, 27, 28, 29, 29¾)”/63.5 (66, 68.6, 71.1, 73.7, 75.6)cm

788389.name: Fasten Convertible Mitts
788389.notes_html:
Fastened, and faster. Plain stockinette mitts with a twist. Knits up quickly for gift giving… or cold hands. With the top ribbing folded down, they’re fingerless mitts. With the ribbing up and the drawstring tied tight: they’re mittens, with none of the palm bulk, buttons, or drafts that come with most fold-over-top style convertible mitts. All of this wrapped up with a bow! The thumb is also a tube of ribbing which can be folded up or down.

Written pattern includes 3 adult sizes, ideas for customizing your mitts, and detailed tips for changing size or gauge.

Yarn: Aran weight yarn. Shown in Malabrigo Merino Worsted (210yds/192m, 3.53oz/ 100g) in color 27, Bobby Blue. All sizes can be made with 1 skein. (approx 120-150 yds).
Gauge: 4.5 sts/in (18 sts/4in, 18sts/10cm) in stockinette stitch.
Needles: In size needed to obtain gauge. I used US 5/3.75mm DPNs.
Notions: Two lengths of thin ribbon or cord, 14-20 in/35.5-51 cm long. OR make your cord by hand using I-cord, braiding, or single crochet.
Sizes: 3 adult sizes. Circumference around palm: 7in/18cm (Small), 8in/20cm (Medium), 8.8in/22cm (Large). Shown in “Small”. Select a size with .5in-1in (1.25cm- 2.5cm) negative ease.

Skills: Cast on, cast off, knit, purl, knit in the round on DPNs, M1 increase, YO increase, SSK decrease, K2tog decrease, place stitches on waste yarn/holder, pick up stitches. Optional: I-cord, single crochet, or braiding (for drawstring).
Accessibility Notes: 12 point san-serif font with bolded 14 point headings, no columns (except for abbreviation key). Due to unusual drawstring construction (no drafts!), they may be particularly useful to those with circulatory problems (such as Raynauds), especially when used as an additional layer over gloves.

800029.name: Slouch Beanie
800029.gauge_description: 18 stitches and 24 rows = 4 inches in stocking stitch
800029.notes_html:
Pull on Hat - Knitting Pattern - fits Adults and Children. Slouchie, beanie style. Worked in double rib, this pattern uses standard Aran weight yarn and is worked on a set of 4 double pointed needles so that it has no seams. This is part of a collection of sewing and knitting patterns suitable for children with sensory processing disorder. see my website for more details.

Age
3 – 12 years  -  head circumfernece approx 45.5 cm (18 in)
12 years - Adult -  head circumfernece approx 56 cm (22in)

Materials
1 ball of King Cole Fashion Aran x 100g ball shade Graphite 314
(200 metres / 219 yards per ball)
 
To substitute: use any standard Aran weight yarn with a given tension of 18 sts and 24 rows to 10 cm on no 5 mm needles – see ball band label for details.

1 set 4 no 4 (US6) double pointed needles.
1 set 4 no 5 (US8) double pointed needles.
(Bamboo needles recommended)

Tension
Over 2 x 2 rib on no 5 mm (without stretching the work) 30 sts and 24 rows - 10 cm square
Over st st on no 5 mm needles 18 sts and 24/25 rows – 10 cm square.
 

 

 
 
Thanks for looking!

users.fave_colors: Aqua, green, purple and pink.... all the colours all together...especially in wool shops!
users.about_me:
I studied fashion at Epsom Art School - now the University of the Creative Arts - completing my course and then taking a circuitous route through a number of design positions until I finally found my niche working as a hand knit, machine knit and crochet designer. I had been knitting and crocheting since childhood so this was very much like coming home.  
	I became an internationally published author, a teacher, and a regular contributor to the major UK Knit and Crochet Magazines.
In the 1990’s children came marching into my life, bringing with them laughter, mayhem and complete disarray.  I was far too busy mopping floors and cooking fish fingers to continue working so this was put on hold.
        The new millennium brought with it a gradual rediscovery of the great joy of knitting, crocheting and most of all designing.  At this time I also worked as a lecturer at Solihull College, teaching pattern cutting and garment construction.
        Since then I have been working again for the UK yarn spinners and magazines. 

Please note I have closed my yarn shop.

800031.name: Top Down Child's Sweater
800031.gauge_description: 18 stitches and 24 rows = 4 inches in stocking stitch
800031.notes_html:
This Top Down Sweater has no seams on the inside and soft rolled hems and neckline. With a big wide neck it is easy to pull on and can be worn either way round as the back and front are the same. It is great for kids with sensory processing disorder - or just for those who like soft and comfy sweaters. Because it is worked Top Down the sleeves and hem can be finished at any length - it could even be made into a tunic or dress.

This is from a collection of sewing and knitting patterns created especially for children with sensory processing disorder.
 
It is worked on a set of four double pointed needles or circular needles and  can be worked in any standard Aran weight yarn, but I have used Cashmerino Aran by Debbie Bliss.

Sizes

Age 3-4, 5-6, 7-8, 9-10 years
Actual Chest
65.5/25¾    70/27½    76.5/30    78.75/31    cm/in
Back length from shoulder
39/15¼    41/16½    43/17    46/18    cm/in
Sleeve Seam
19/7½    21.5/8½    24/9½    26.5/10½    cm/in

Materials
5 (6, 6, 7) balls of Debbie Bliss Cashmerino Aran x 50g balls shade 041 Grey/Green
90 metres (98 yards) per ball

To substitute: use any standard Aran weight yarn with a given tension of 18 sts and 24 rows to 10 cm square on 5 mm (US 8) needles – see ball band label for details.
1 set 4 x 4 mm (US 6) double pointed needles.
1 set 4 x 5 mm (US 8) double pointed needles.
Optional Circular needle no 5 mm (US 8) needle length 60 cm
(bamboo needles recommended for the dpns)
 

Thanks for looking!

800034.name: Child's Easy Cowl Hoodie
800034.gauge_description: 13 stitches and 20 rows = 4 inches in stocking stitch
800034.notes_html:
Knitting Pattern PDF for a Knitted Cowl that can be worn in a variety of ways. Pull it down over the arms to feel snug, warm, safe and enclosed. Pull up over the head as well, or just wear it as a scarf or cowl round the neck to jazz up an outfit. 
 
The cowl can be worked in any yarn, but I have made it using 100% cotton which is super child friendly.

This pattern is one of a collection of sewing and knitting patterns created especially for children with sensory processing disorder. See more on my website at www.ruthmaddockmakes.com
 
To fit Ages:         
3-4      5-6      7-8      9-10            years
 
Actual Measurements
(Measure around body and arms at chest level—the cowl should be snug)
70       75       80       85       90           cms
27.5    29.5    31.5    33.5    35.5        inches
 
Tension
On no 6.5 mm needles and worked over st st  - 13 sts and 20 rows =10 cm square
 
Materials
4(5,6,7) x 50g balls Lang Yarns Grande 100% cotton shade 935.0034
(Each ball has 62 meters of yarn)
First 2 sizes: 6.5 mm x 40 cm circular needle
Last 3 sizes: 6.5 mm x 60 cm circular needle
 
To Substitute
Use same length of any chunky yarn with a standard tension on no 7 mm needles worked over st st of 12 sts and 21 rows to 10 cm square. (This is the information on the ball band label – this cowl is worked on smaller needles)
 

Thanks for looking!

805451.name: Inside Out Socks
805451.sizes_available: Circumferences Narrow - 7 inches/17.78 centimetres Medium - 8 inches/20.3 centimetres Wide - 9 inches/22.8 centimetres Extra Wide - 10 inches/25.4 centimetres Foot length is customizable
805451.gauge_description: 8 stitches and 12 rows = 1 inch in Pattern Stitch
805451.notes_html:
**

Create your own ebook! Put any 4 patterns in your cart and only pay for 3!

**
Slipped stitches and dropped stitches play beautifully with variegated yarn! The stitch pattern used in Inside Out socks is easy to memorize and results in a beautifully textured fabric that doesn’t compete with the short colour changes in variegated yarns.

This sock is worked cuff down with a reverse stockinette short row heel, princess sole and reverse stockinette toe. This sock has the added feature of being reversible - 2 pairs of socks in 1!

YARN
Sample is knit using Sea Turtle Fiber Arts Ridley Sock 80 superwash merino /20% nylon; 400 yards (365 metres)/115 grams (4 ounces); ‘Smashed’; 1 skein

NEEDLES
1 set 2.25mm (US size 1) needles in preferred needle style for working in The round or size needed to obtain Gauge

NOTIONS
Stitch markers
Tapestry needle
Removable stitch markers (optional)

GAUGE
8 sts & 12 rounds = 1 inch/2.5
centimetres in reverse stockinette
stitch in the round after blocking
8 sts & 12 rounds = 1 inch/2.5
centimetres in in pattern stitch
in the round after blocking

SIZES
Circumferences:
Narrow - 7 inches/17.78 centimetres
Medium - 8 inches/20.3 centimetres
Wide - 9 inches/22.8 centimetres
Extra Wide - 10 inches/25.4 centimetres
Foot length is customizable

SKILLS
Knit
Purl
Increases
Decreases
Short Rows
Working in the round
Dropped stitches
Slipped stitches
Kitchener stitch

Thank you to my tech editor for editing this pattern and to all the awesome test knitters who test knit it.

users.about_me:
I am a knitwear designer specializing in socks! I create unique, beautiful, knitting patterns that are graded for multiple sizes. 

A well written pattern allows you to express your creativity and focus on enjoying your craft.  You will create beautiful, stylish, one-of-a-kind socks for yourself and your loved ones. 

I am a sarcastic, nerdy, yarn-loving, obsessive knitter who finds inspiration in anything and everything.

I have far more ideas than I have time and my yarn stash has its own bedroom in our house.

My designs have been featured in I Like Knitting magazine, Blue Moon Fiber Arts Socks That Rock Rockin' Sock club, Interweave Knits, Knitscene, Love of Knitting and I am proud to be a contributing designer to the Knits In A Day published by Stackpole Books and to Artful Arches published by KnitPicks.

In my previous life I have been a Financial Planner in the Wealth Management industry, worked as a credit counsellor for a non-profit community agency and run my own property management business.

I love being a part of the amazing, generous and talented fibre arts community.

I live in Ontario, Canada with my husband, 2 super-awesome kids, 2 furry-lovey dogs and 2 fluffy-charming cats. 

Join my [Ravelry Group!][1]
[Sign up for my Newsletter][2] (and a free pattern!)

My patterns have all been tested and tech edited. 

You can see lots of yarn and knitting porn on my Instagram feed: [danagervais][3]
You can see sneak peeks of upcoming designs and opportunities to test knit Dana’s designs on my [Facebook Page][4]
In addition to Ravelry, my designs can be found on [Craftsy][6] and [LoveKnitting][7]
I blog at www.DanaGervaisDesigns.com and can be reached by email at Hello@DanaGervaisDesigns.com

  [7]: http://www.loveknitting.com/us/catalogsearch/result/?order=relevance&dir=desc&q=dana+gervais

In my previous life I have been a Financial Planner in the Wealth Management industry, worked as a credit counsellor for a non-profit community agency and run my own property management business.

I love being a part of the amazing, generous and talented fibre arts community.

I live in Ontario, Canada with my husband, 2 super-awesome kids, 2 furry-lovey dogs and 2 fluffy-charming cats.

Join my Ravelry Group!
Sign up for my Newsletter (and a free pattern!)

My patterns have all been tested and tech edited.

You can see lots of yarn and knitting porn on my Instagram feed: danagervais
You can see sneak peeks of upcoming designs and opportunities to test knit Dana’s designs on my Facebook Page
In addition to Ravelry, my designs can be found on Craftsy and LoveKnitting
I blog at www.DanaGervaisDesigns.com and can be reached by email at Hello@DanaGervaisDesigns.com

806677.name: The Princess and the Pea
806677.notes_html:
We all have a Princess in our life, you’d love to knit her some socks, but they would be far too harsh on her Princess feet. This is the just the pattern for your Princess, featuring not just a Princess heel, but no purl bumps anywhere for her beautiful feet. Seek out the softest sock yarn to make the ultimate gift for your beloved Princess.

However, just between you and me, we want to know if she is a real life Princess right? So the Pea is at the back of the Sock is more than a design element!

This pattern looks incredibly simple, but as it is knitted inside out, the instructions may appear counter-intuitive. This and the fact that reverse stockinette can be unforgiving, the pattern can be challenging.

818813.name: Marilue Cowl
818813.gauge_description: 9 stitches and 14 rows = 4 inches in Stockinette Stitch in the round
818813.notes_html:
Access the free pattern here: https://differentviewdesigns.com/marilue-cowl-knit-and-cr...

The Marilue Cowl is an Adaptive Knitwear pattern. The finished product is specifically designed to be easy to get on and off for individuals that have limited dexterity or other needs that make wearing traditional scarves difficult.
The cowl Is knit in the round with a crocheted scallop edging. It is designed to stand upright and fit perfectly under a coat in the winter. Or fold it over for a more low profile look. It even works as an ear warmer! Just double it up and pull it over your ears!

Use a single color for the body and the edging or choose your own color combination.

This pattern is suitable for anyone with basic knitting and crocheting skills. Necessary skills include knitting in the round, single crochet, double crochet, and slip stitch.

Finished Measurements
Height: 7” / 17.75 cm
Circumference: 21” / 53.5 cm

Yarn Requirements
80 - 100 yds / 75 - 92 m of bulky weight, cat 6 yarn

Yarn Shown in Sample
Lionbrand Hometown USA

Needles/Hook
10mm / US 15, 16”/40 cm circular needle
10mm / N crochet hook

Gauge
9 sts x 14 rows in stockinette stitch

Techniques and Skills
Basic knit stitches
Basic crochet stitches
Knitting in the round

pattern_author.name: Liz Sheffield
pattern_author.notes:
Hi!  I’m Liz, the designer behind Different View Designs.  After my Mom got diagnosed with ALS, I was frustrated and overwhelmed by feeling like there was nothing I could do for her as she fought this disease. When she passed away I dedicate my business to serving individuals that needed assistance dressing or had limited dexterity.  My pieces are beautiful, because I passionately believe that no one should have to choose between functionality and feeling great in their clothes.  Each piece is then designed with thoughtful details to make it easier to wear or put on.
My first piece, the Marilue Cowl, is dedicated to my mother.
A few of my pieces are still available for free on my website, see individual listings for more info.

819870.name: Wheelchair Sweater
819870.gauge_description: 13 stitches and 18 rows = 4 inches in Fleck Stitch
819870.notes_html:
I designed this sweater to meet the needs of someone in a wheelchair.

It is my experience that a shawl doesn’t stay in place or it catches in the wheels. A blanket doesn’t warm the upper body and a sweater bunches uncomfortably at the back of the chair. Someone with limited mobility can’t adjust for comfort and warmth.

This design has a shortened back for warmth but not bulk. It has sleeves to hold the fit and allow for movement.

This unisex sweater, is easy to knit, seamless and knit top down with room to adjust front and sleeve lengths. My experience is that full cut sleeves are not as successful for my clients so the pattern has short sleeves that you can adjust.

This garment is worked seamlessly from the top-down using the contiguous sleeve method developed by Susie Myers, SusieM on Ravelry (http://www.ravelry.com/people/SusieM).

822227.name: The Ribbet Tee
822227.sizes_available: S, M, L, XL, Small-extra large
822227.gauge_description: 15 stitches and 8 rows = 4 inches in hdc
822227.notes_html:
This pattern was created long before I knew what size inclusivity meant or how to do it. It is retired until I can get back to it.

Do you love ribbing as much as I do? Are you looking for a stylish tee? The Ribbet Tee’s texture is airy enough to keep you comfortable on warm spring days and cool summer nights. Wear it with a contrasting tank underneath for added flare.

Embrace the art of crochet with ‘The Ribbet Tee’ pattern, a versatile and stylish addition to your wardrobe. This easy-level project is perfect for crocheters looking to create a comfortable and chic top. The adaptive design allows for customization in sizes ranging from Small to Extra Large, ensuring a perfect fit for every body type. Constructed using the bottom-up method and worked flat, this pattern features a flattering ribbed design that adds texture and interest to the garment. With clear written instructions, even beginners can confidently tackle this project. Whether you choose Everyday Worsted Solids, Marls & Heathers from Premier Yarns or Soft (Solids & Heathers) from Red Heart, the result will be a cozy and fashionable tee that you’ll love to wear.

Unique Features-

• Easy-level pattern suitable for all skill levels
• Sizes available from Small to Extra Large
• Flattering ribbed design adds texture
• Constructed using the bottom-up method
• Adaptive design for customization
• Works flat for easy construction

Materials Needed-
-Yarn: - Everyday Worsted Solids, Marls & Heathers by Premier Yarns (Aran weight) - Soft (Solids & Heathers) by Red Heart (Aran weight) Hook: - 5.5mm (US Size 9.0) - 5mm (US Size 8.0) Yarn Needle Scissors Stitch Markers

• Gauge: 15 Stitches by 8 Row = 4 Inches in Hdc

825821.name: Beth's Wristwarmers
825821.gauge_description: 30 stitches and 40 rows = 4 inches in Stocking stitch
825821.notes_html:
This is a stash buster pattern and designed to be used with left over sock yarn. Having made a generous pair of socks with the Debbie Bliss Rialto Luxury Sock yarn, I was left with plenty of yarn to make these - 31g to be precise!

I made them for a friend of mine who has arthritis in her wrists, they are designed to keep her joints warm and not get in the way. Wristwarmers are often too loose or slip and slide so that you cannot get on with things. These are comfortably snug, and the thumb holds them in position to they don’t move about. The also finish relatively low down on the fingers so as not to prevent any dexterity.

I have made one pair for my friend and already have three people wanting pairs, so I thought I would stick the pattern on Ravelry to see if other people like them as well!

Size:
Quite snug, but not tight, a bit like a sock on your hand

Gauge info:
Follow your wool gauge

Materials needed:
Any left over sock yarn - about 30g

830285.name: Basketweave Poncho
830285.gauge_description: 20 stitches and 30 rows = 4 inches in 5 stitch by 5 row basket weave
830285.notes_html:
I created this pattern with several requirements in mind. I wanted it in different weights of yarn, but the exact same pattern. I wanted to be able to use either a 3 weight yarn or a worsted weight yarn.

I wanted to use solids and the lovely Mandela/Self-striping yarn.

I wanted the length to be adjustable, to let the knitter decide whether or not to make the pattern longer. The pattern does make the length shown, but just keep doing the last repeat to make it longer if you prefer.

I wanted something the elderly could wear in a wheelchair and not be concerned about it catching in the wheels. It can also be work by nursing mothers for “modesty” reasons. It would also be lovely for young girls. And yes, that is all in this one pattern. Just choose the yarn you want to use and appropriate needle to go with it.

This may also be made with a crew neck instead of the rolled ribbed neck. Many possibilities.

Plus it is an easy pattern to memorize!

Thank you for choosing my pattern.
